page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF BURTON PIDSEA
page.content: Burton Pidsea is a small village approximately 10 miles to the north- east of the city of Kingston upon Hull, and about the same distance from the coast. It has a population of close to 1000 people which has grown rapidly over the past 10 years. The village is surrounded by arable farmland, the greater part of which is sown with rape. The village has a fine church which dates back to 1180 and it is set in a pretty, quiet village which has retained its friendly atmosphere despite its rapid growth. Many of its new inhabitants are young professionals who commute to Hull for their business, yet the village remains essentially a family village with many generations living close together.
